channel.title: What would be better?
channel.description:
Today I came to an idea where I'd clear the entire process, and load everything individually on player log-in using Event Manager. Such as player saving, special attack regeneration etc. Is this a bad idea and I should just leave the process crammed with everything?
[IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/9kv7ty.png[/img]

item.title: What would be better?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:6, topic:549881”][quote author=Motekiku link=topic=668764.msg4472443#msg4472443 date=1423875944]
Thank-you I really appreciate it.
[/quote]
No problem man. Anything else just ask :)[/quote]dont believe me just watch

Read full topic

item.title: What would be better?
item.dc:creator: @Motekiku Motekiku
item.description:
@Motekiku wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:4, topic:549881”]1. The EventManager shouldn’t even be used anymore. The way most people utilize it makes it not thread safe, and Jagex themselves have stated that all tasks are ran in 600ms intervals making the EventManager (generally) inaccurate. It’s also a bit redundant because the Java API already provides ScheduledExecutorService which can do everything the EventManger can, with a ton more functionality. Use Graham’s new cycle based task system instead, you can find it here.

  1. Yeah, as Vain_ stated that’s a pretty bad idea. One major gain in using tasks is that you’re only processing for (most) things when needed. Everything should have it’s own individual task that is only ran when needed.[/quote]

Thank-you I really appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: What would be better?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

  1. The EventManager shouldn’t even be used anymore. The way most people utilize it makes it not thread safe, and Jagex themselves have stated that all tasks are ran in 600ms intervals making the EventManager (generally) inaccurate. It’s also a bit redundant because the Java API already provides ScheduledExecutorService which can do everything the EventManger can, with a ton more functionality. Use Graham’s new cycle based task system instead, you can find it here.

  2. Yeah, as Vain_ stated that’s a pretty bad idea. One major gain in using tasks is that you’re only processing for (most) things when needed. Everything should have it’s own individual task that is only ran when needed.

Read full topic

item.title: What would be better?
item.dc:creator: @Motekiku Motekiku
item.description:
@Motekiku wrote:

Vain_:

is bad

I was just thinking of making each thing have it’s own void, and timer.

Processing everything individually, with different timers so it’s not bunched up together.

Process special attack.
Process regeneration.
Process player saving.

Read full topic
